sources.title: China Gate.(1957)
sources.description: Gene Barry, Angie Dickinson, Nat King Cole, Lee van Cleef, Marcel Dalio, James Hong, Samuel Fuller pancoligo

sources.title: China Gate (1957) The film is set during the First Indochina War (1946–1954)
sources.description:
China Gate is a 1957 American CinemaScope war film written, produced and directed by Samuel Fuller and released through 20th Century Fox. The film is set during the First Indochina War (1946–1954), and depicts the relationship between a sergeant of the French Foreign Legion and the Eurasian wife whom he had abandoned.

Original title: China Gate (1957) AKA: Gates of China

This film has Spanish audio, and subtitled in many languages.

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/Q6Rp-t7WLm0

Director & Writer: Samuel Fuller
Stars: Gene Barry, Angie Dickinson, Nat 'King' Cole, & Lee Van Cleef
Genres: Colorized, Action, Drama, War


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdY01vosli-hdsPbpYQBnsi9

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Near the end of the French phase of the Vietnam War, a group of mercenaries are recruited to travel through enemy territory to the Chinese border, to blow up an arms depot. A Eurasian smuggler, Lucky Legs, agrees to use her connections to help them, in return getting her son into America. The racist father of the boy, Sergeant Brock, is also part of the multinational group. Lucky Legs must use the love of a Eurasian guerilla leader, Major Cham, to get access to the base. Will they destroy the base, and will Brock overcome his racism before Lucky Legs makes The Ultimate Sacrifice?
metadata.Actors: Gene Barry, Angie Dickinson, Nat 'King' Cole
